text: Jackie sits alone on the train. He reads the NY Times, every once in a while circling an item, scribbling notes. An MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN across from him stares. Jackie offers a brief glimpse then turns away.
Excuse me? I know you... Don’t I know you?
No! Jackie returns to his notes. The Old Woman, speechless, goes back to minding her own business.

I don’t think it’s just me. I don’t think human beings were meant to be together. Want a relationship? Get a canary. Get a fish. Don’t get a cat -- that’s too sad. But get a hamster. Get a dog. A dog’s always happy to see you. A dog don’t judge. Like when You’ re late?

You can even bring another dog home. Sure, your steady dog might get a little jealous, but the worst he’s gonna do is pee on your carpet, shit on the floor, maybe chew up a shoe or two. My third wife did all those things. But then she went and did what all wives do -- she got a lawyer. A dog will never do that. A dog will never go out and get a lawyer. And here’s another thing a dog will never do. When a dog dies, it will not be resurrected 25 years later on “Nostalgia Night.” Now I’m not suggesting anything, but if you get the right kind of dog-- (CONTINUED)

ARLEEENE! Don’t serve me any foreign food ... only Hamburgers, Hot Dogs and Egg Rolls.
AREEEENE! If God wanted us to eat Potato pancakes, he would have made Jesus a Jew. As drinks arrive, Harmony grabs hers and drinks it down.
OK. Show’s over. Lets order.
How about the timing? Give me some imput. (CONTINUED)
I thought you were me for a second. Try it again while you’re drinking a glass of water.
I got more... ‘ARLEEENE...Eddie junior here is wearing a tutu! A tutu! Hahahaha. God you were great... Jackie gives Harmony a look as if to say “this is fucking hell”.
Have another drink. It helps. Mac sees Harmony slide her drink to Jackie.
So how did you two meet?
We do community service at the Mission.
Oh right. Yeah well, that’s all over, baby. I got’em to transfer your hours to Florida. Harmony reacts angrily. Jackie clocks her reaction.
We talked about that. What if I don’t want to go to Florida?
You don’t know what you want. (to Jackie) She’s always been a troubled girl.
I’m still at the table!
(to Harmony) Look, it’s done. I chartered a plane. We leave tomorrow. Jackie watches Harmony, upset, down her drink. Jackie slides his scotch over to her. She drinks that. (CONTINUED)
Jackie sees an opportunity to back her up and irritate Mac, so he sets Mac up:
What’s in Florida?
I own this retirement community in Del Re b ny Beach. We help the elderly live out their lives with some dignity.
Be nice to get through dinner with some dignity.
She’s so good with the old people. She’s got a magic touch. Jackie takes her hand, much to Mac’s distress:
Well, she’s a wonderful person. (to Harmony) It’s OK Honey. We’1ll wait til your back from Florida before we find a place.
What? Jackie now gets revenge by irking Mac.
We’re moving in together. Is it OK if I call you Dad?
You're a funny man. But this is my daughter.
Every woman’s somebody’s daughter. I pretty sure that Puerto Rican girl was somebody’s granddaughter.
Harmony’s my daughter. She’s not somebody’s punch line. She’s special. Harmony lets out an sarcastic laugh. (CONTINUED)
I want another drink. Jackie rubs Harmony’s hand comfortingly.
Whatever you want baby. He gestures the Waiter. Mac is seething.
I don’t like what I’m seeing here.
Maybe you should wear glasses.
No offense but you look much older than I pictured you.
That’s funny, cause you look much older but I never pictured you.
When I see you looking at my daughter and the way she’s looking at you...
How am I looking at him?
I want to know what are your expectations here?
(overlap) My expectations?
(overlap) Expectations. Yeah. With my daughter? Harmony knows where Jackie’s going with this.
(under her breath) Oh shit. 63. (CONTINUED)
To fuck her brains out. After that, we’ll see. A new martini arrives. Harmony downs it.
You know, I’m a sucker for a clown.
And I’m a sucker for a girl with daddy issues. Harmony’s had enough.
Jackie? Would you wait at the bar for me? Jackie rises, looking at Mac.
Sure. You've been a terrific crowd. See ya Pop. Jackie exits OK. Mac turns to Harmony.
Don’t tell me you’re interested in that schmuck?
No. And if you would have shut the fuck up for a second, you would’ve known that. But you never stop talking.
Oh. OK. So my driver’1l pick you up at 9, we leave at noon.
Unbelievable. Harmony rises. IMPROV OVERLAP HARMONY/MAC:

Where are you going? He’s I’m leaving. You’ re the an asshole. Let him go. I asshole. He has nothing to 46 do this because I love you. do with it. How could talk I’m always the bad guy. I about me like that. I’ve don’t get it. had it with you... (CONTINUED)
Harmony stops Mac... *
Stop. I’m not doing this ina * steak house. * (kisses him) * Happy Birthday. * Harmony exits. Mac pulls out his cell phone. *
Rosa? Come back. *
INT. HARMONY’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 48 Jackie and Harmony come off the stairs into the hall. *
You should have seen the look on * your face when Mack yelled -- * (imitating Mack * imitating Jackie * doing Eddie) *
Jackie shakes his head. Winces. * They walk into the living room. *
Hey, this is nice. It’s worth * risking your life every time you * step outside. Are you sure you * want to leave? *

I have to. My community service * has been officially moved to the * Sunshine State. All I have is * bourbon. * Harmony points to a BOTTLE OF BOURBON on a tray with two glasses, and begins rummaging through a HALF PACKED *
HARMONY (CONT’ D) I’ll be up all night packing. (CONTINUED)
Don’t pack now. Relax.
I’m not packing; I’m looking for my weed. You know, Florida’s actually not so bad for me. I do enjoy working with the old people. And I’m good at it. And Florida has a lot to offer.
Like what besides skin cancer? Harmony laughs.
You know what I loved. I loved how you pissed off Mack.
Why do let him talk to you like that?
He always has. That’s Mack.
What about your mother?
She left when I was four. Mack never told me why.
Because she was married to him. I met the guy for fifteen minutes and I was ready to leave. Harmony laughs.
I can’t leave. He controls everything I do.
Mack can be a dick, but at least he’s there. (she nods) I wasn’t for my kid. (CONTINUED)
After we met, I googled you ... I read about your son passing away. I’m so sorry. HARMONY (VERSION 2) (CONT’D) You have children?
I had a son ... He passed away.
Oh God, I’m so sorry.
I wasn’t any kind of father. And I have to live with that.
How do you get through something like that?
I’m a comedian. I did jokes about his horrible mother.
Come on. Do one now! She stands and takes the Bourbon Bottle and holds it like a microphone. HARMONY (CONT’ D) Ladies and gentlemen, Jackie Burke!
Naa.
Come on.
Will it get me laid?
Depends how funny it is. Jackie takes the “microphone.”
Hello everybody. Looks like a good crowd tonight. (MORE) (CONTINUED)
[PLACE HOLDER JOKE] I was never religious until I met my third wife. Then I prayed every day for her to get hit by a fuckin’ bus. (Jackie Improv) )
Eh
Okay, try this: Did you hear about the daddy’s girl who fucked the 67-year-old comedian?

You’re only 67? I thought you were 70. Jackie Shugs, or adlibs. HARMONY (CONT’ D) You killed. Come here. Jackie sits down beside on the couch. Suddenly, Harmony rolls over atop of Jackie, straddling him. She starts to unbutton her dress. HARMONY (CONT’ D) This doesn’t mean anything.
It’s just something I feel like doing right now.
Be gentle. It’s my first time Harmony pulls her dress down to her waiste, revealing here lovely Perla bra.
And you’re not staying the night.
Why don’t I just leave my dick here and pick it up in the morning. (CONTINUED)
48 + eH OF
HA! If only. * She kisses him and pulls Jackie down OFF SCREEN. * She laughs. *

INT. HARMONY’S APARTMENT -- MORNING 49 Morning light easing through the blinds, Jackie stirs. He swings his arm around and realizes no one is there. He walks from the bedroom to the living room, making a quick recon, Harmony and her suitcases are gone. Jackie is disappointed. He sees her note: “Dear Jackie. Thanks for the laugh. * Love, HARMONY.” * Jackie feels good. It was a great night. But he knows it’s over. Never to happen again. He gets dressed. EXT. FRIAR’S CLUB - DAYS LATER. 50 Jackie’s got on a casual coat and boots - a bit bohemian. He walks up to the ornate Friars Club entrance. INT. FRIAR’S CLUB - MILTON BERLE BAR - CONTINUOUS - DAY 5 Stain Glass Windows set a classy tone. Tables are filled with comics and Broadway types playing cards & kibitzing. Portraits of great entertainers line the walls. Miller sits at the bar alone, going over notes.
(hand her a phone)
Miller listens;

Yeah, it’s fine. Send him up.  52 70. INT. FRIAR’S CLUB - LOBBY - CONTINUOUS - DAY Jackie stands waiting for the elevator in the Friar’s Club Vaulted Lobby - the place reeks of old world class. A Chinese waiter walks up carrying a covered dish on a tray. Jackie leans down and takes a wiff.
Chow mein? The waiter lifts the metal top, revealing a hamburger.
Fuck you.
I guess so. The elevator opens and Jackie and the Waiter enter, but before the door closes, BILLY CRYSTAL slips into the elevator and presses the button for the 3nd floor.
Good afternoon, Friar Crystal.
Hello Teddy. Hi ya, Jackie.
Hey Billy. How’s life?
Not bad. Gonna grab a haircut before I do Fallon tonight. How bout you?
(deadpan) Chow mein. Billy nods. The Waiter laughs. The elevator opens.
Be good.
See ya, Billy. Jackie exits onto the 2nd Floor where we see the ornately carved oak staircase. 52

53 71. INT. FRIAR’S CLUB - MILTON BERLE BAR - CONTINUOUS - DAY Jackie spots Miller - who waves him over, but su he hears a familiar voice D’ ANGELO Hey, look who’s here? Jackie turns and sees a table of comics playing the corner, including his rival DICK D’ ANGELO.
Look who it is - Jackie boy! Jackie has to stop and be pleasant. D’ ANGELO Still funny?
No, I’m doing your jokes now. They all laugh. D’Angelo grabs Jackie’s arm. D’ ANGELO Sit for a second.
I’m in a rush. ddenly, cards in D'Angelo rises, playing to the guys at the table. D’ ANGELO Heard you’ve been having a rough time. If you need anything, we’re here.
Sure, if I ever catch syphilas I’ll get in touch. D’ ANGELO You hear that Freddy, why isn’t there more love in the world.
There’s too much ... Syphilas!
Why aren’t there more great comedians in the world. (CONTINUED)
D’ ANGELO Are we still holding a grudge?
Are you still doin’ my act, Dick? D’ ANGELO Only the good bits. The guys at the table laugh ... knowing Jackie’s right. * Jackie walks over to Miller at the bar. *
I fired you.
(nods to bartender Chivas on the rocks for Mr. Burke. A drop a water.
Jackie sits. *
I’ve got a possible gig.
What? I dress up as “Eddie” for a children’s birthday party? *
You want a job or you want to be asshole?
I have to choose? *

I’m the Treasurer here. We had a meeting last night. We’re doing a big tribute to May Connor February 1. Big event. TV special. Network thinks they’1l1 pull 7 million viewers. He looks up to a portrait of MAY CONNOR - legendary * entertainer. The portrait was painted during her heyday.
May Conner ... Love her. * (CONTINUED)
Jackie swallows - he doesn’t say ‘No”, (2)
D'Angelo is responsible for the program. He’s calling the shots. And as of now, it’s overbooked.
Great. Is Billy doing it?
As of now, he’s not available but we’re hoping that changes.
And if that changes, it’s not overbooked for him.

Billy Crystal is royalty. You’re not even a member anymore. You can’t show up once in a blue moon and expect to be on the dais. You gotta rejoin. (nods at D’Angelo) Kiss the ring. Just this once. the opportunity, calling out to D’Angelo. D'Angelo rises nonchalantly and walks over.
Dick, you got a minute. knowing he’s been set-up, whispers to Miller. *

What a shit fucking world this is. (dead serious) Listen - I want a good spot in the rotation (D’ Angelo approaches) and I don’t want to go after this fuck, because he’1l have already destroyed my best jokes. D’ ANGELO (arriving) You want a spot on May’s tribute?
Miller mentioned it. Actually, I’d be honored to do it. 73. 53 so Miller seizes * Jackie * He looks up at the photo of May Conner on the wall. * (CONTINUED)
She’s a barely living legend. * D'Angelo clocks Jackie’s line. * D’ ANGELO * (deadpan) * Funny. * (puts hand on *

Jackie’s shoulder) Well, I’m not saying for sure - it’s overbooked now - but anything is possible. Jackie unexpectedly takes D’Angelo’s hand and kisses it. They are both amused. D’Angelo leans in. D’ ANGELO Miller told me you’re thinking about rejoining. If you did, that would go a long way. But, since I’m also head of the membership committee, I need to ask you a serious question.

OK Dick. Shoot. D’ ANGELO Is your parole officer joining the club with you? Because I can get you a couples membership. D'Angelo smiles coldly. Jackie forces a smile. * D’ ANGELO (to Miller) Tell Lydia to give him an application on the way out. D'Angelo returns to his table. Miller looks at Jackie.
You did good. Didn’t so hurt so much, did it?
I need a power wash. *
Can I tell you something I bet you * don’t know? (MORE) (CONTINUED)
About ten years after “Home With * Eddie”, Dad said to me “I’m sorry * I ever got Jackie that sitcom. It ruined him. He could’ve been so much more”. Jackie didn’t expect this.

INT. JACKIE’S APARTMENT - NIGHT 54 Jackie preparing for the May Connor roast event. Grooming. Practising lines. He pours himself a Jamison’s Harmony. He checks his CELL TEXT FILES. ON JACKIE’ CELL: We see THREE OR FOUR TEXTS TO HARMONY sent over the past two months that have been delivered but never answered by her. Jackie goes to his laptop. Brings up GOLDEN VISTA VILLAGE - Mac’s Empire is very impressive. He dials the number into his cell...waits .... gets Harmony’s answering maching:
Hey Harmony... how you doin’. * I’ve left a couple of messages - * you OK? I’m doin’ a big TV thing *
tonight ... it could be good Tell Mac to go “fuck-off”. Jackie hangs up and continues to dress.

Jackie walks into an Art-Deco Balcony where VIPS are gathered for a Pre-Show Reception. Photographers are shooting various combos of comics who take turns standing beside the guest of honor: MAY CONNOR - 93 - dressed to the nines. Sitting with an Attendant standing by her.
Can we take a break with the pictures? I need a martini. Jackie enters. He greets the other comics as he makes his way to May. He kneels over and gives her a kiss. (CONTINUED)
Hey kid!
May, what an honor to be ripping you a new one in the name of such a worthy cause. May lights up a Camel cigarette.
Mind if I smoke?
I don’t care if you burn.
(laughs hard) I always loved that line.
I loved Gleason.
Gleason loved my tits.
I don’t think you can smoke inside.
I’m 95. If I want to smoke, piss on the sidewalk and say the N word, I’ll fucking do it. (to Jackie) The world today! So goddamn serious about everything.
I’m going to the bar. Martini? One olive?
God bless you. Jackie crosses to the bar, meeting up with Miller, D’Angelo and RICHARD BELZER.
Oh my God, the comic from Alcatraz. (CONTINUED)
They all laugh. Throughout the scene, D’Angelo is eating from a small bowl of nuts.
Good to have you back, Jackie.
Thanks Rich.
You look nice. How you holdin up?
Better than D’Angelo’s act. So what’s the order tonight?
Well, Richie has to make a late flight. Dick has to get up for an early call... D’ ANGELO I got a day on a Spielberg movie.
You playing a dick or a corpse? Either way you don’t have to act. D'Angelo chuckles, knowing he set himself up.
So you get to close out the show.
What? I thought I told you--
There was nothing I could do.

You know, this is why I stopped being a member. I get fucked every time with you guys. You invite me to one of these things, you put me on last and I lose. D’ ANGELO It’s a tribute, not a competition. We’re all in this together. (CONTINUED)

Fuck you. Then you go on last. By the time Belzer introduces me, every joke about this old broad will have been told fifteen times. D’ ANGELO That’s why we need you to close. You’ re at your best when you’ re working without a net.

Again, Fuck you! D’ ANGELO That’s not nice. A YOUNGER COMIC passes by, reaches over and grabs some nuts out of D’Angelo’s bowl. D’Angelo loses his calm. D’ ANGELO Who told you you could eat my nuts? These are my nuts! You don’t touch them. The young comic looks at D’Angelo like he’s old dirt. Then he purposely drops the nuts back into the bowl;
(cold & cynical) Sorry MR. D’Angelo. He exits.
Why don’t you put him on last? D’ ANGELO He pulls in the Comedy Central crowd. D’ Angelo walks over to get a new bowl of nuts.
Jackie, this is still good. You’re getting tremendous visibility. Just knock’em all outta the game.
Miller, please. Don’t play pep talk guy - it doesn’t suit you. (CONTINUED)
(signs) Ok, Jackie. You got notes you want me put on the teleprompter.
No. * Jackie turns to Haitian Bartender as Miller exits O.S.
Gimme a martini, one olive and a double chivas on the rocks.
My man, “Eddie”. Wow. What’s up “Eddie”?
Everything’s up. My blood pressure. My dick. Your work visa.
(cracks up) I still love watching your show, Eddie. I eat my dinner and watch it late at night after work.
Yeah, well, sorry you don’t have more of a life. And just for the record, my name is Jackie - so fuck off and die in whatever country you swam here.
(eating it up) You always sooo crazy. CUT TO; A LARGE DISC HANGS FROM THE CEILING WITH MAY’S PHOTO IN 5 THE MIDDLE - AROUND THE OUTSIDE: “MAY CONNER TRIBUTE”

The event is in full swing. The dais is filled with recognizable talents. Jackie is seated at the far end, looking over his notes. You can tell his blood is up. Richard Belzer is Master of Ceremonies, seated to the right of the podium. May is seated to the right. (CONTINUED)

May is drinking another martini. There is a microphone in front of her. Dick D’Angelo is at the podium finishing his spot. D’ ANGELO May, listen to me okay? I’m your friend, okay? It’s over. You’re finished. Finito! Your movies are on the History Channel. Mild audience laughter. May nods, rolling her eyes - she’s heard that one many times before. She leans into her microphone.
And your movies -- oh wait, you don’t have any movies. Big laughs from the audience. D’ ANGELO All joking aside...

What jokes? D’ ANGELO You truly are one of the greatest talents in this business. What can I say? You're barely a living legend. Laughs. Jackie recognizes his own joke. His impulses take over...Before D’Angelo can say another word Jackie appears and pushes him hard out of the way -- essentially highjacking the podium and the fourth spot...

That’s enough Dick... (to audience) Wake up people. The “Whatever- Happened-To” portion of the evening is officially over. The audience applauds. They think it’s planned. D’ ANGELO Go to hell Jackie. Or do you need your parole officer’s permission to get there? Big laughs. D’Angelo sits down. Belzer leans into mic: (CONTINUED)
Applause. 81.
Folks, please welcome back to the Friars Jackie Burkie, also known as “Eddie”, also known as prisoner 942828. Jackie takes control at the podium. No notes.
Yeah, I did a little time. But my thirty days seems short compared to your having to listen to D'Angelo for five minutes. Laughs. He turns to May. May breaks Big laughs.

May. Oh May. We’ve heard a lot about your many accomplishments tonight, but no one’s really talked about how tough it was for you starting out. Today you can get the part just by blowing the director. God, when I think of the things you had to do... up.

Whatever you did worked because you played some of the most iconic roles in the history of film. And me, Jackie Burke, was with you all the way ... When you played the title role in “The Battleship Potemkin”. I was one of the sailors you took on. You remember me - I came in the porthole. May included.

Then we were re-united in “Wizard of Oz”. Does this sound familiar? (sings high pitched Munchkin voice) Ding dong the witch is dead...And even though we are inbred...You gave a hundred munchkins head! Laughs are building. May coughs laughing. Drinks water. (CONTINUED)

And then who could ever forget when we were together in the original “Poseidon Adventure”. You as the Poseidon. Me as a cabin boy. Remember my audition? Jackie puts his hand on the front top of his head simulating hair and flicks his tongue rapidly...
(through laughter) Yes! And you got the part! Applause and laughter. Audience is loving Jackie.
And I learned how to make the Poseidon capsize. The Audience is eating it up. May is convulsed.
Yes, May O’Connor, you chewed a lot of scenery in your time...and apparently swallowed.
Swallowed!

In all seriousness, May Connor is not only the greatest actress of our generation - and, okay, the several generations preceding this one -- she’s a great sport. Thanks to May, we’re raising a ton of money tonight for Meals on Wheels. (Jackie leads Applause.) Wait: “May”...”a ton”...”meals on wheels”...Add in an Oscar and fucking more young boys than the entire Los Angeles Archdiocese and you've got May’s whole biography. May laughing hard and wheezing now.
Jackie! Stop! Jackie puts an affectionate hand on May’s shoulder. The crowd applauds wildly. (CONTINUED)
May looks like she’s laughing out of control - but is also writhing in her chair, as if something might be wrong. Jackie just goes with it.

Seriously May? An orgasm? Now? Her body trembles. She motions for him to stop. Suddenly, May slumps over. Her head hits the table hard, right in front of her mic. Everyone gasps, leaping to their feet. Richard Belzer and others hurry to help her. No one is paying attention to Jackie. The dais guests gather around May. Jackie is dazed, still in his comic high mode:
Its OK, May, don’t worry. D’Angelo’s not coming back. Richard Belzer pulls the mic away from Jackie to yell:
Is there a doctor in the house? But May is gone. Her body surrounded by crying people. As EMT workers move onto the dais Jackie is pushed back and bumps into D’Angelo. D’ ANGELO Wow. You killed.

I didn’t even get to my best stuff. INT. JACKIE’S APARTMENT - BEDROOM - NIGHT 58 Jackie sits on his bed, still dressed in his dinner jacket, eating Chinese out of a paper container. He flips on the TV.
Doctors confirmed Miss Connor’s heart attack was preceded by a serious of illnesses including diabetes and two strokes...” The screen cuts to Dick D’Angelo being interviewed: (CONTINUED)

D’ ANGELO ON TV We lost a great one tonight : I’m devastated ... May and I were more than just friends - we were Jackie sits there watching D’Angelo steal his moment. He flips the channel and there’s D’Angelo again. D’ ANGELO ON TV “Fans all over the world will be mourning her death. She was truly America’s Queen of Comedy... Jackie Flips again: D’ ANGELO ON TV “,..Family members requested that the Friars cancel the broadcast, and of course, we agreed. Jackie shuts off the TV. He just stares at the black screen for a moment, then he reaches over and grabs a VHS tape off the shelf. He inserts the cassette into an old video player and presses play. He watches a clip of: “HOME WITH EDDIE”: EDDIE, A WORKING CLASS EVERYMAN, TALKS

head_text.subj: TO HIS TV WIFE, ARLENE, AS SHE CARVES OUT A PUMPKIN FOR

text: “EDDIE” Arlene, when you son decides to dress up as a ballerina, it’s no longer about trick or treating. CANNED LAUGHTER. “ARLENE” Oh Eddie, he’s only nine. Give him a chance to find himself. He needs to explore. “EDDIE” Explore what Arlene? His friends’ rectum... CANNED LAUGHTER. EDDIE JUNIOR enters, dressed in a pink tutu with purple tights. Jackie watches from his bed with the concentration of a masochist receiving his beating. “EDDIE JUNIOR” Hi Mom. Hi Dad. (CONTINUED)

“EDDIE” Hey son. How was you day? “EDDIE JUNIOR” (effeminate) Fabulous CANNED LAUGHTER. Eddie grabs a football and tosses it to Eddie Junior. It whizzes by the kid who makes no attempt to catch it. “EDDIE” ARLEEEEENE... Jackie shuts off the TV. He sits in darkness. Silence. 59
Jackie meets with Miller over lunch.
Not in NY. No club work. James brings Miller a sandwich, Jackie a cup of coffee.
(to Jackie) Nothing for you? Jackie shakes his head. James exits.
I’ve gotten three offers for appearances. In Wisconsin, there’s a Democratic fund raiser. *
An hour of bashing Republicans - a * Comedian’s dream. What else. *

There’s a three day master comedy * class seminar at SOAS College. It’s in London. And the third - you’re not going to like but it * pays the most - it’s a television classics autograph convention in West Palm Beach - doing “Eddie”. (CONTINUED)
How much they pay in Wisconsin?
$3000, plus expenses.
London?
$5000, but you’ve got to pay for your own ticket.
Florida?
$25,000 plus expenses. Her cell rings. She checks screen.
I’ve got to take this. She rises and exits 0.S. Jackie sits alone contemplating the shit turn his life is taking. James appears.
She finished with this?
No, she’s coming back. James sits opposite Jackie as Florie enters. James’s eyes go wide. Flo crosses and stops when she sees Jackie.
Flo. You look nice. Flo stares at him a beat, then turns to James;
Please tell your brother if I ever see him in here again, I’1l cut off his dick and pickle it like a herring. She walks off. James and Jackie take a beat, then:
You got thirty days, I got life. (CONTINUED)
James says Oh please, sing. Beat. James leans in, (2)
Does she know? Cause, now with what happened, you gotta tell her it’s going to be a little longer before I can pay you back.
She knows. And we both agree, we don’t want you to pay us back.
No, come on. Don’t be like that. It’s gonna be a issue...
No, no, it’s not. I want you to keep that money ‘cause then I’m free and clear.
What does that mean? 87. 59 the following louder so Flo can hear him:
It means I’m done with this. You don’t show up again out of the blue asking for anything again.
What are you mad about now?
(quiet) I’m not mad. (louder) Nobody’s wrong here. People don’t change...
ya singing the People are who they are, my same fucking song ya always brother. And that’s that.
OK. The truth is you see how it is with her. You’ve become a thing. speaking in a quieter tone; (CONTINUED)
(overlap) I’m a thing now...?

Yeah. You’re a thing. And I can’t do it. I can’t take the aggravation. So please. Let it be. (beat) I thought you killed at the wedding. Brittany loved it. If you're ever performing, you let me know...we’1l have a beer. Miller returns.

So what’s it going to be? Wisconsin, London or Florida? EXT. GOLDEN VISTA VILLAGE - WEST PALM BEACH - DAY 60° Jackie drives a convertible along the Intercoastal * waterway - Palm trees and dense tropical foliege everywhere.

We have a really special treat for * everyone today here at Golden * Vista! * INT. GOLDEN VISTA VILLAGE - DINING ROOM - DAY 6h Mac is speaking on a mic in front of the residents who * are spread out round the tables. A little stage with an * electronic piano with a mic is set up behind Mac. *

A wonderful entertainer who’s * playing the lead in the musical * “Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde” over at * the Mitzi Gaynor Theater in Coral * Gables. Let’s give a hand to Devin * O’Donnor. * DEVIN O’DONNOLL appears - 40’s, every inch the performer who never made it past regional theater. His enthusiasm * is phony. His attitude patronizing. And he is clueless *
about his transparent ego. He thinks he’s a star. (CONTINUED)

Thank you so, so much, Mac. What a beautiful audience. I want to tell you, even though we’re performing to packed houses at “The Mitzie”, I was looking forward to this performance more than any other... Devon cues a PIANIST at an electronic piano, who underscores; DEVON (CONT’D) ...Because being here with you, makes me feel...alive. DEVON STARTS TO SING SONDHEIM’S “BEING ALIVE”: DEVON (CONT’D) “SOMEBODY HOLD ME TO CLOSE...SOMEBODY HURT ME TOO DEEP” Various Cut-aways to elderly characters, some we will come to know as MIRIAM, ADELE, HERMAN and BERNIE. Some are paying attention. Others are falling asleep. Harmony moves between the tables - obviously well liked.
Jackie approaches the RECEPTIONIST.
Where can I find Harmony Schutz? Jackie looks into the lobby and out through the windows at a beautiful swimming pool right on the Intercoastal. Mac’s spread is very impressive.
Oh, you’re here for the dinner?
